Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: oman54
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at the Dikker & Thijs Fenice Hotel. It's a tidy hotel, well placed for Leidesplein and the nightlife it has to offer. The trams run adjacent to the entrance but you can't hear them. The rooms are of a good size and nice and clean. I'm off there again in October and may stay here again. If you come out of the main entrance and turn right you are on Prinzengracht and about 200 metres on the right is a fantastic cocktail lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is located in one best locations of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: vinylmeister
Reviews.Content: We choose Dikker & Thijs Fenice hotel because of it's location. This hotel is located close to Amsterdam's Leidseplein and in the middle of Amsterdams heart. The perfect location to visit Amsterdam by feet (anyway it is better to leave your car at a safe place and visit the center walking) We booked a room with view on the Prinsengracht. The room was very spacious with a large bathroom, bed room and sitting area. The breakfast is a self-service continental breakfast (with omelettes and grilled bacon) with a variety of Dutch cheese and meats. The service at the reception is very profiession and efficient Positive: Probable one of the best locations in Amsterdam Spacious room Negative: Pricy Has no own car parking facilities Wifi is not included in the room price

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: maldita1010
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on Prinsengracht and we find that almost all places to visit are near the hotel. It is also near to where the night life is in Amsterdam. The room itself is clean. Nice bathroom with tub. Rooms are soundproof. The room isnt big but is sufficient since you will be in Amsterdam for sight-seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy on the street side”
Reviews.Author: scizin
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights while attending a trade show at the Rai. In bad weather the walk to the tram would have been too long, but we were luck and enjoyed the 10 minute stroll through town and past the flower market. The hotel staff were very nice and the location is great, except that my room faced the main road and the noise at night was unbearable. From what I saw some of the rooms are very nice (mine was) and some very plain and with showers only (my first room). When I asked to move to a room with a full bath the hotel was happy to accomodate - only that night when I couldn't get any sleep because of the noiaw did I realize why the first room, albeit not as nice, would have been the better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in such a fun town.”
Reviews.Author: Jody F
Reviews.Content: Great location on a canal and in a happenin' part of town, the Leidseplein. You can walk everywhere from this hotel. Staff is gracious, knowledgeable, and very helpful. Our room was a LOVELY surprise, large and spacious, clean and well appointed. This is one of the few hotels are that is equipped with an elevator, and in Amsterdam with the narrow stairways, that amenity is PRICELESS. Our only complaint would have to be the tram RIGHT outside our window. Had to sleep with earplugs. The suites on the backside of the hotel are much larger but super quiet, and of course more expensive. Couldn't beat the location and the staff. Might I also recommend the small corner Pattiserie across the street for FANTABULOUS eats.

Reviews.Title: “To be recommended”
Reviews.Author: Simon B
Reviews.Content: If you are looing for an hotel in a great location - overlooking the canal - you couldn't do better. It is perfectly situated for museums galleries and the sites all in a short walk. The room we had - paid for overlooking the canal - was very roomy, light and comfortable. Didn't eat in the hotel - why would you when such tremedous options nearby and the breakfast is expec=nsive - as everyone says - so eat at a nearby cafe. Surprisingly quiet for one so well located.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Magic”
Reviews.Author: Quentin_Sargent
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in old Amsterdam. Ideal for business or pleasure. The hotel is located in a busy (and touresty) part of Amsterdam with plenty of restaurants and bars in the area. Good for business as it is right in the tram line.

Reviews.Title: “a little pearl in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: rikduyck
Reviews.Content: dikker & thijs is a small, well located hotel near het leidse plein clean, well furnished with public transport nearby

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, can be a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: quesochica
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were really great-- efficient and very friendly. Our room was fantastic....huge. I was expecting some tiny little closet (as is often the case in older cities). Instead, they gave us the triple room which had an extra twin bed in addition to a small table/chair set-up. Very comfortable. The location of the hotel was very central. On the convergence of three major tram lines and walkable to the museum district. It's in an area of a lot of tourist hotels and restaurants. This is good because it was easy to find morning coffee and conveniences such as the drug store. But also bad because it was on a noisy corner. But then, we were there over New Year's so the whole city was noisy. If you are a super light sleeper, I'd say request a quiet room or choose a quieter neighborhood. But for us, this was an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Very good location with everything within walking distance. The staff were very professional and friendly. My room was spacious and I could feel comfortable. Bath products were nice, bathroom in my room was also acious though no tub even though one could have easily fit. Nice view to the channel. Breakfast was good but expensive. No free WiFi-access available.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: Islb
Reviews.Content: We had a superior room, was very big comfortable and clean. Not too much noise, mostly from the penthouse above. Would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot”
Reviews.Author: paulde
Reviews.Content: Can't argue with the other reviews here. Location is good - just out of the city centre but within walking distance to everything; our room (at the top) was spacious, clean and cosy (although we had to endure two single beds put together rather than a 'proper' double, not unusual in Northern Europe, but I loathe this). It's got lots of character, and lots of stairs (not a problem for me, but might be for some); the main problem as others have noted is the street noise, which basically continues all night, so avoid if you want something quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: juan070
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife 3 nights on 1st Oct. (her birthday present). We had a large double on the 2nd floor. The bedroom and bathroom were spotlessly clean. From other reviews we were well aware of the noise level from trams and late night revellers. We missed breakfast as we went to bed late and it would have been a struggle to get up early. There is tea and coffee making facilities in the room and a Starbucks just opp. the hotel. The staff are very nice and helpful. Then the location. Just a minute from Leidesplein with all its bars restaurants coffee shops night clubs and so near to the museums. So for all of these our next stay will surely be the Dikker again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jan4
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here for 4 nights mid september. We had a very large room with twin beds and a seating area that had doors with Juliette balcony overlooking the canal. Had not booked a canal view room but were given one anyway. Our room was on the 2nd floor around the corner from all the noise of trams and late night drinkers so we weren't bothered by any noise.Had breakfast on 2 occasions had plenty of choice but somewhat extorionate price of 17 euros.Reception staff variable mostly pleasant but one staff member pretty disinterested answering questions.Internet in our room poor signal so mostly used the lounge area on 2nd floor for internet access. Thought overall rather expensive but location very central to Museums, Anne Frank house and lovely Jordaan area.Would use hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Not worth 4 stars, but good location”
Reviews.Author: sanji
Reviews.Content: The room was a disappointment : the bed was packed between 2 walls, which means the only possibility to go to bed was from the feet side. No space to put glasses or a watch. Furthermore, the room was overall noisy, as the phonic isolation seemed weak. I wrote an email to the staff to mention those points, but never received any answer...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay near everything.”
Reviews.Author: delaplanche
Reviews.Content: Well located between the channels and with a beautiful view of Princengracht. Bathroom spacious and clean, as was the room. Kind and very helpfull staff. An ice machine could be provided, at least in the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Location with 3 Star Rooms...”
Reviews.Author: Flamenco_Sun
Reviews.Content: Oh my... where do I start? As you will have gathered from the other reviews, the location of this hotel is perfect for getting to all the main attractions and galleries of Amsterdam on foot. The price you pay for this convenience is noise and not exactly the most picturesque position in this beautiful city. Yes, the hotel is on the wonderful Prinsengracht canal, but it's also on a terribly busy corner and opposite a chip shop and a kebab shop on the main drag down to Leidesplein. If you want a romantic, quiet retreat on a canal, this definitely isn't it. If you want to be in the heart of the action though, give it a whirl. Our room overlooked the main street and it was very noisy, (probably stoned) mayhem well into the early hours. The room also had no air-con, so we had the fan provided right next to the bed just to stay semi-cool (it was way too noisy to have the window open...). The rooms aren't comparable with other 4 star hotels I've stayed in: they are more akin to 3 star, but perfectly comfortable (except for the air con). But the corridors etc are a real let down here - very poor stairwells that have a dark, depressing institutionalised feel about them. We did find the reception staff very friendly and efficient, so plus points there. However, the maid service was just bizarre: we literally had someone hanging around outside our door waiting for us to leave for breakfast each day! This wasn't late, by the way - it was around 8:00-8:30am. It happened for 3 days on the trot: there they were waiting for us to leave, and then they would be inside the room before we'd even reached the stairs! It was kind of comical, kind of creepy. If I were in Amsterdam again for 1 night, I'd consider this place for its convenience. But for a longer stay, I'd be seeking somewhere a bit quieter. Note: I had to give this hotel a 'very good' review, as 'average' would have been too mean. In reality, it's somewhere between the two - i.e. just a plain old 'good'. Alas, there's no option for that.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great part of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Jmrodriguezesq
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was ideal, within walking distance to the art museums. The hotel sits on a corner of a street that leads to a very happening plaza filled with restaurants and bars. I would definitely return to this hotel. The staff at the front desk could be a little more friendly.

Reviews.Title: “underrated excellence”
Reviews.Author: CelestialNomad
Reviews.Content: Hotel review sites and the hotel website itself dont give a clear idea of how amazin this hotel is. The location is perfect if you want something central but not too noisey. A 20 min bus journey (197) from schipol gets you pretty much to the doorstep of this hotel. The staff are immensely helpful and given that I paid for a 'standard double room', I got the largest room I have ever seen with beautiful canal views from the first floor. Minibars ar teh bain of my travelling life with stupid pricing. This hotel is the most reasonable I have seen. Anything and everything is in walking distance and I dont think I would stay in any other hotel. Any other reviewers who have given this hotel a less than perfect score are unreasonably critical

Reviews.Title: “We won't be back because of the staff and the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Attila23
Reviews.Content: Our first impression with the hotel was during the check-in. Alas the lady was so unfriendly that I had to be almost as rude as her just in order to get the things going, get our room and leave the reception. The room was nice but not what you would expect from an hotel in the 4 star category, I would rate it as a 3-star because the furniture was worn out and the equipments just average. I have been to better 3-stars hotels in Amsterdam, not to mention the staff which almost made us leave without checking-in. The third disappointment was the isolation: our bed was placed against a wall from which you could hear all details of the neighbours' bathroom. Fortunately that did not wake me up because I was already up at 6:30 as the windows did not sufficiently isolate from the streets noise. I guess there is nothing to do about it but once more, you would expect better from a 4-star hotel. All in all the worst hotel we've been to in Amsterdam, such a pity because the location is perfect. Just pick another one, there are plenty around.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location..would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: BridUiChadhla
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first romantic trip away together in a few years, we booked a meet and greet taxi through the hotel and he picked us up and brought us directly there and couldnt have been nicer! I had contacted the hotel beforehand and arranged for some champagne and strawberries (which were the nicest and juiciest I have ever had!) to be in the room, and they were. We had booked a canal view room and it was amazing, bathtub, seperate toilet, beautiful views of the canal yet our sleep wasnt interrupted by passers by late at night. This hotel is very central, with a tram stop just outside the door. It is close to the Leidesplein - entertainment area, also the Vondelpark and Van Gogh Museum is within walking distance. We spent a lot of time just walking around different streets from the hotel. Room was serviced every day and the staff were always available for questions or advice. We didnt eat in the restaurant as from the look of the menu it just wasnt to our taste but there are plenty of areas close by to eat in.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: asaf78
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Dikker & Thijs hotel for 3 nights and enjoyed it very much. Our room was specious, comfortable and clean, we didn't have a canal view but we had a big window facing the street, with a lot of light coming through it. Even though located on one of Amsterdam's busiest streets, the double plated windows are extremely effective in keeping the noise out. From very few interactions, staff seems to be nice and helpful. Location is excellent for touring Amsterdam; walking distance to all main attractions, tram station just outside the hotel, and lots of bars, restaurants and coffee shops near by. Considering the reasonable pricing - great value for money, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: BusyJane
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for a 3 night stay based on other reviews on TA. We were extremely pleased with the service, the position ( a great spot on a canal and so close to a tram line!) and the general helpfulness of the staff. The basic rooms are not large but more than adequate for two people. One thing we noticed is that there is a very nice lounge area on a mezzanine floor above the bar/restaurant which we were not told about, but is perfect for time out from the room, to read or just chat.

Reviews.Title: “Problems and They Just Don't Care”
Reviews.Author: ktoui1
Reviews.Content: The room was great with lots of windows which did not open, fun view, clean, BUT the (sink) water did not work for one night. No help was offered, not even a bottle of water. As we checked in, a couple checking out said the internet never worked. We got it to work but it was free for 30 minutes then you had to pay. The elevator did not work one morning and evening. The staff was utterly nonchalant to outright snippy. I added a night, they said it would be no problem, then they "forgot" and we we told the room was taken for the night and we had to leave. Also, they lock the doors whenever the deskperson leaves the desk, no sign, no notice, not even a "Be back in 5 minutes". They just don't care. Breakfast is overpriced and only goes until 9:30. The coffee and bagel place on the corner is much cheaper and friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “This is a gem in the coolest city I have ever visited!”
Reviews.Author: BeckiBoo24
Reviews.Content: This was a great little hotel right in the heart of Amsterdam. It is situated literally steps from the tram (which you can take all over the place). The staff was great, the rooms and bathroom were big, the hotel bar and restaurant was very hip.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the romatic rooms and private dining and definitely will come back”
Reviews.Author: Starfishandstella
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Dikker & Thijs Hotel in Amsterdam with a few couples and we loved it. Our room was under the roof with original wood trusses and a great view at Prinsengracht. The staff was very friendly and we definitely enjoyed our stay. When we stayed there, we also had dinner at the newly opened restaurant Thijs in the basement. Great food Italian style and we loved the wines, too. For the birthday of my husband we rented the Private Dining facility, which made this dinner intimate and very special. We really recommend this great place and when we go back to Amsterdam, we'll book it again!

Reviews.Title: “We want to come back”
Reviews.Author: hmendonca
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, confortable and big bedroom. Very good location, a lot of restaurants, bars etc around and from the window a beautiful view from the Prinsengracht canal. Beautiful! Strongly recommended. Internet is not free though - 24h of use for 10 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value & ideal location - I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: photovagabond
Reviews.Content: I've been to Amsterdam multiple times for both business and pleasure - while this was a business trip the hotel came out of my own pocket so I was bargain hunting. I found a great rate on Booking.com for this hotel for about a third of the conference hotel rate - and couldn't be happier - Canal-view room on the 4th floor, spacious room, clean, comfortable, friendly staff (if not always very chatty) - generous breakfast in the lovely restaurant on the basement level. The hotel itself is situated just off the Leiseplein - literally steps away from three major tram lines - and a half block away from Starbucks and free wireless (not so secret weakness) - I was able to attend my conference, explore all of my old haunts and visit friends easily via public transport - couldn't have asked for a better base of operations. My only dig is that they should have free wireless for guests - get with the times folks! As a woman traveling alone I felt very secure. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Emelda
Reviews.Content: Girlie weekend in Holland, one night in Amsterdam. Booked superior room with canal view (2nd floor 308). Room was spacious, twin beds and chairs to relax on with a glass of wine. So nice to watch barges going by and enjoy the skill of the captains as they negotiated the bridges, busy area, but did not disturb sleep. Clean, comfortable, would love to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: laminpa
Reviews.Content: We arranged a last minute sojourn to Amsterdam and experienced sticker shock in attempting to find a nice room in a nice section of the city -- one that reflected the charm and beauty of this cityscape. I spent several hours looking online and kept coming back to the Dikker & Thijs hotel. We secured 2 rooms in the hotel and upon arriving were very happy to see that the rooms were large, comfortable, nicely appointed, and overlooking the canal -- and smoke free. They were also at a price that didn't break the bank. The hotel is situated in a very accessible part of the city -- close to everywhere, and also on a tram line. We would definitely stay there again. We did not get the breakfast choice as most of the other recommendations warned against them. There are several bakeries and shops nearby that served us well. They also offer 15 minutes of free wireless internet/day and I believe it then ran 2.5 euro/hr after that, which in comparison to some other hotels, did not seem unreasonable. The positives were many, but there were a few negatives: you must turn in your hotel key when you leave your room -- this is not a problem, but at least 3 times when we came back to hotel, the front desk was not staffed. As the front door was locked when the front desk was unattended, it took several minutes for someone to arrive to let us back into the hotel. It seemed as if they were short-staffed at the desk, although the staff was helpful when we asked. Another thing that we found worrisome was that there was a heavy cement planter blocking the emergency exit from the hotel -- it was moved when we noticed it.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: hpm66
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 1 night, and were upgraded to a superior room on the 2nd floor, with dual aspect to the canal and to the Leidsestraat. Despite being on the 1st floor (room 104), and despite the buzz of busy sunday evening traffic and trams going past, we found the room remarkably quiet. It was a massive room, which could have easily accommodated 2 double beds. Spacious bathroom too, and lovely seating area by the bay window. Staff at reception were very helpful and friendly. We didn't try the breakfast in this hotel, as there are so many different places in its immediate vicinity. We found this an excellent truly 4-star hotel and - at a price that's lower than any of the main budgethotel chains in Amsterdam - amazing value for money. Will definitely be coming here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location on the channel district”
Reviews.Author: sten_80
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is very good - on the channel district next to Leidseplein. Good connections with tram. Our room was spacious - unfortunately we didn't have channel views but on the other hand we had very peaceful sleep without disturbance from the street. Breakfast (~17â‚¬) wasn't good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great view !”
Reviews.Author: Nelsworth
Reviews.Content: Shocked to see the last couple of reviews as our experience was the opposite. We turned up at this hotel by chance as we were looking for a room overlooking the canals. The girl on reception was very polite and helpful and offered us a room overlooking the canal at a very reasonable rate. Having looked at the standards and prices in two previous hotels on our way here I can certainly say this is one of the better hotels in Amsterdam. The room was a good size, very clean and a great view. We were on the 4th floor. It was a little noisey at night but this was a city break and the hustle and bustle is what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “loud, aged and overprized”
Reviews.Author: anhei
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a superior room for one night in March 2011. The room was large but still had a small bed and small desk. When arriving, the room as not heated and freezing cold. Overlooking the street I heard the tram going by every couple of minutes, very uncomfortable background noise. Curtains did not close properly so the room was lit up all night. Front Desk staff showed their dis-interest in working there. Overall I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very rude staff, old uncomfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: R-Almeida
Reviews.Content: Location ok, near to Leidseplein, but far from Dam and Jordaan. Clean room. Very old hotel, my room was dark with a small claustrophobic window facing a depressing backyard. Very noisy ventilation. Matress very uncomfortable. Poor bathroom. Poor breakfast only until ten and expensive. Stairs and stairs and stairs, not suitable for people with difficulties. Old and slow lift. But the worst in this hotel is the unfriendly and rude staff. Never met people like these in my life! Not a 4 star hotel, in a decent standard it would be a 2/3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: jess_2419
Reviews.Content: The Dikker & Thijs Fenice Hotel was great. We stayed there for a night in Feb 2011 and since it was a slow season (I assume) they upgraded our room. It was an awesome room - we loved it. I'm not sure what the room would have been like for the price we paid, but the room we got was definitely amazing. The hotel allowed pets as well, which was great as we travel a lot with our dog. Some of the reviews complain about the noise from the street, but we didn't encounter this. Our room was a corner room, so above the tram stop (great location by the way!) but we were on the 4th floor and had the windows closed as it was winter. So it may be louder in the summer? Overall, a great and friendly place, and would definitely stay there again when in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Matty43
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful and friendly, room was clean and comfortable, excellent location. It was good to have tram stops outside the hotel for going sightseeing and there were lots of bars, restaurants and shops near to the hotel. Even though this hotel is near bars and trams we never found it to be too noisy at night.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: IsraelMichal
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, sprkling clean, friendly and helpful staf. nice andcentral location, and good breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mosiniak
Reviews.Content: i stayed one night and had a pleasant time. The staff were very helpful and friendly. room 102 was huge. It its easily the biggest hotel room I've stayed a2 in all of europe. Two things I didn't care for: the tram noise was rather loud in my room and the beds were way too hard for my liking.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dragos68
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my husband 3 nights at the end of January. Thanks to tripadvisor comments, better then this one wasn't possible. The hotel is a very old one but everything was renovated and very clean. Because of its location in the night can be loud but this is the city of Amsterdam. In to my opinion if you want to stay in the center of the city it has to be loud, because the city never sleeps. We had a very nice time in this hotel and in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value, nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: jjxxtt
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was good, but not super great. I think we might have chosen the wrong location as it wasn't as close to Dam square as we had hoped. This area is close to many, many restaurants and fairly close to the I am Amsterdam letters and Rijksmuseum. The shopping in Amsterdam is pretty awesome as there seems to be a good shopping strip everywhere. Our room was on the second floor and pretty quiet. We didn't hear any noise on the nights we stayed. Internet is free for 15 minutes a day, and 2.5euro for an hour which is fairly good. The main reason why this isn't a four-star rating is mainly because of the location, but that is really our own fault rather than the hotels. Staff are nice and helpful. The room was a good size and bathroom was pretty clean. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, rather choosing to eat breakfast in the surrounding cafes. We really enjoyed Amsterdam but would have preferred to stay closer to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “very good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: oneguide
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights in this hotel and I had a very good time; my room was on the 5th floor with incredible view of the city, it looked like just being renovated. The staff at the reception and in the rooms was very kind. I hope to come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but loud!”
Reviews.Author: Ninge712
Reviews.Content: My sister and I traveled through Europe this spring. Our stop in Amsterdam was unfortunately during the 14 day garbage strike but the Dikker & Thijs was a nice escape. It was centrally located - we walked from the train station and were able to walk to all the museums. The rooms were clean and nice. We asked for a canal view so we could enjoy the beautiful scenery. Unfortunately, beautiful scenery = very loud! There were cars, trains, people, you name it outside our windows all night long. So while it was a nice hotel for a reasonable amount of money the lack of sleep was very unfortunate for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly welcome”
Reviews.Author: AlfredENeumann
Reviews.Content: It's always the same when you have booked and paid in advance in an expensive hotel. You arrive and the employees think the guest is a crook. Even though I paid in advance, they wanted again my credit card details and mumbled that this is needed in case I would break something!!! This is a strange attitude and as a guest you are trapped, because you cannot simply say "ok, I'll skip my trip and go somewhere else". Knowing that all hotels are fully booked and apply more or less the same policy. There are only a few honest hotels that really welcome their guests and appreciate their coming. Perhaps I'm from the wrong planet, but I was really pissed by the arogancy of this behaviour. All other positive (yes there were some) and negative points I will not mention because I could not forget the "welcome" during the two nights!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Dalaigh
Reviews.Content: Originally recommended to me by a friend, The Dikker en Thijs did not disappoint! The staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were spacious and extremely clean. The beds were so comfortable and the noise was minimal. (if you want absolute silence, don't come to Leidseplein!) Hopped off the tram from Centraal and walked straight in the door, went out to Leidseplein at night and strolled home in 2 minutes without having to worry about taxis, trams, etc. The reception staff helped us out with tram info (we had friends staying on the other side of town) and were very patient and informative. Also, we got a great room (208) with a fantastic view of the canal, and we didn't even request a canal view room. I can't wait to go back to Amsterdam and I can't wait to go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a party location!”
Reviews.Author: carollinga
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quiet & comfortable. We arrived very early in the day and were able to check right in, which was fantastic after a 10 hour flight. We even had a canal view! But everything you've read about location was right. After long days of exploring and getting lost, it was great to party at the numerous Leidesplein clubs and eat at the restaurants, especially as in October it gets dark early. The door policy keeps the hotel feeling very safe and secure. Very clean and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “ok for a tourist not so great for business traveller”
Reviews.Author: ta2306
Reviews.Content: Myself and a colleague just stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. Good points: Great location Friendly staff Large rooms Mainly clean Free internet in lobby for 15 mins a day Bad points: Slight noise at night - didn't keep us awake but I can imagine if you are on a low floor or a light sleeper it would. The bathroom tiles need to be cleaned! The rest of the room was spotless but the bathroom tiles look like they hadn't been cleaned for a while. The towels - if you can call them that - are as thing as rouch toilet paper and the size of a tea towel. Room service advertised before the visit was not room service. There is a not in your room to say for 4 hours a night they will deliver food to your room at a cost of â‚¬ 5 extra and to contact reception for what they have. This is not room service! Mini bar - no snacks, just drinks. No free water or slippers, minor points but as a business traveller I extect these. To be honest you need slippers in the bathroom as the tiles are very slippy. Hotel bar is shut on a Sunday and it is really not worth going into the rest of the week, it is quite depressing. I can't comment on breakfast as we didn't eat there. I think if you need a bed and a central place for a sightseeing weekend and you won't be spending much time is you room this hotel is adequate, but it is not for the business traveller or someone who wants more than basic. I would rate it an average 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely recommend !!!”
Reviews.Author: Vienna76
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel was very pleasing and effective, the room was a good decor with all the amenities that one could need. There was a good assortment of buffet breakfast in the morning time and the place of this hotel was good in relation to transport with several bars and shop close by that suggested a broad and diverse alternative - I would absolutely publication afresh when traveling to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: catsinbrooklyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the first two nights in Amsterdam. Later moved on to a hotel in Jordaan area. Good Location (ideal esp. if it's the first time in Amsterdam), noise not a problem at all (ask for a backside room), boring decor, overpriced

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: JNW
Reviews.Content: We had a canaly-facing room on the second floor. Despite the fact that the locals were partying on the streets due to winning the World Cup semifinal match, our double-paned windows kept out most of the noise. The location is outstanding. My only beef with the place is that they turned off the air conditioning at night, which made the room somewhat uncomfortable. For the price, however, it was a pleasurable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, noisy location”
Reviews.Author: dlev4
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a well appointed, spacious room, with a nice sitting area, AND can sleep through anything or don't mind sleeping with ear plugs, this is a great place to stay. The location is both its blessing and its curse. It is on the corner of Prinsengracht and Leidsestraat which puts you in reasonable walking distance of much of Amsterdam, and is adjacent to one of the more popular restaurant and night life areas. Don't feel like walking? No problem, the tram runs directly in front of the hotel, wherein lies the drawback. The trams run non-stop every few minutes from 6:00 AM until midnight. After that, the people coming from the bars and nightspots make their way down Leidsstraat to the all-night food establishments across from the hotel, often singing or shouting. This continues for a couple of hours during the week, or until 4:00-5:00 in the morning on the weekend. If you are a heavy sleeper or can tolerate ear plugs (which I was able to do by our third night), the noises of the evening will not be an issue. Other than the outside noise, we loved this hotel. I would guess that if you could get a room as far away from Leidesstraat as possible, or a room not facing the street at all, the noise won't be an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Hot & noisy - otherwise nice large, clean room.”
Reviews.Author: jazzangel
Reviews.Content: This is without doubt the hottest hotel room I have ever stayed in, and it is impossible to leave the windows open as the street noise outside is unbearable until the wee hours. I'm sure as a tourist, the location is excellent as it is really central but if you need to sleep & get up for a days work then unless you can sleep through anything then don't stay here. The rooms are well sized, clean and well equipped however.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: PSMaka
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel! ther service was great, front desk was very helpful. Anything that wasn't in the room, they would let us borrow- such as an iron, a microwave for leftovers, and they had a computer that we could use to access the internet in the lobby. We had a room on the second floor facing the street and it was amazing! My husband and I don't mind the street noise from the metro, we actually liked it. Location wise it's great, its near a touristy area- near some nice outdoor seating bars/restaurants and an area that is referred to "restaurant row". It was a perfect a low key nightlife in this area. To keep it short, there was nothing we did not like about the hotel, We were really pleased with the location, service, and the rooms!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: clbr5
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I stayed here for 3 nights before heading to a conference. Amsterdam is a fabulous city and the Dikker & Thijs is in a great location for access to the tram and restaurants. The room was large and had a great view, our window was right at the Fenice sign on the side of the building along Prensingradt. We were in room 208, I think it was called a deluxe double. It was a bit pricey but clean with good service. We had breakfast every day at the little cafe in the hotel and it was good. There might be some suitable alternatives but DTF worked out great for us. The only negative thing would be that it is a bit noisy at night. It is near a very popular square so people are up VERY late and singing in the streets.

Reviews.Title: “hmmm?, not very friendly”
Reviews.Author: georgex999
Reviews.Content: i am a frequent visitor to Amsterdam and have stayed in many hotels in the city Centre. This hotel is a primo location but the two times i have stayed there, the front desk attendants are very discourteous and not very helpful. I wont stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Place!”
Reviews.Author: dontbeugly
Reviews.Content: The Tulips are in full bloom! We stayed in Amsterdam then took the 30 minute drive to Keukenhof to see the flowers as only Holland can provide. Two adults, two Yorkies, and one Labrador - the hotel welcomed all of us and it was in a wonderful location. We stayed in the penthouse and the view was fabulous. Elevator all the way to the fifth floor and then 10-12 stairs to the penthouse. Staff was friendly and helpful. The location is only a block from huge outdoor cafe area and canal cruise departure. A little noisy at night, but nothing too bad. Parking was at a nearby garage and car was well taken care of. Delicious bakery for a morning croisaant across the street. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Jorch67
Reviews.Content: My rooms was in 1st floor and next to the tram stops 20meters away but the street noise stayed out because of good noise insulation windows. Room was pretty small but it did not have odd smell, it was clean, had nice bed, cosy interior, minibar and tv. Bathroom was average: Enough big to handle two persons and nice shower but cold floor... Breakfast was bit disappointment, 12euros for bread/croisant/coffe/boxed cereal breakfast was too much but there is about 20 places nearby to buy decent breakfast IF you can wait till 10am to get those breakfasts... I did this once when I was leaving the city. The hotel itself says that it's 4-star hotel but I would say it's 3-star, very good 3-start though!! Nearby hotel (500meter radius) has enough bars and restaurants to eat and drink almost what ever you want. I tested Indian food (very nice), Hard Rock Cafe (normal ;-), two Italian (both good) and Chinese take-away (OK) Nearby trams (numbers 1 and 5) takes you to central train station, shopping district and to museum district. Both places are anyway under 2 kilometers away from this hotel so it's very easy to move around by walking too!! The way from/to airport is easy. Take intercity train from Chipol airport to Amsterdam CS train station and from there take tram 1 or 5 to the hotel. Very easy!!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: MaineIzzy
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in room #308. A very large room with double bed (actually two twin beds pushed together), big bathroom and nice view of canal. Sitting area looks out on canal with floor-to-ceiling windows that open wide. In-room coffee maker and mini fridge. Huge armoire. Bathroom has no natural light but room gets lots of light. Helpful and efficient staff. Our room faced the quiet side of the street, while just around the corner there are tons of shops (inc coffee shops), bars, stores and restaurants. Easy walk to Anne Frank House and Van Gogh Museum. Tram right out the door. The beds were hard, but European beds always seem that way. The layout of the floors is a bit unusual - to get to our room we took an elevator then had to go up a flight of stairs. A bit tricky with luggage and no help finding room or carrying luggage was offered (we found a housekeeper who kindly helped). We had trouble sleeping - the tram noise was noticeable and our upstairs neighbors apparently were a family of ballet-dancing elephants (or they may have been walking normally and it's just nature of the rooms).

Reviews.Title: “Well located for seeing the sights”
Reviews.Author: The_Aitchs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on a tram stop on the Prinsengracht canal, perfectly situated for shops and restaurants. We had a very comfortable and spacious room on the 2nd floor - our window was just above the "Thijs" sign on the outside of the building! The room was well-equipped with minibar and tea & coffee making facilities. Lovely shower room with complimentary toiletries and face cloths too. I think the rooms must have been recently refurished as there was a faint smell of paint in the air - and the room and shower room were spotlessly clean. We could hear the noise from the trams and there are lots of people around at night but we were pretty tired from walking around the sights so we slept really well anyway. We didn't get breakfast at the hotel but instead got some croissants from the bakers across the street. They were lovely - highly recommended! All in all, this is a very comfortable hotel in a great location if you want to be close to the main tourist parts of Amsterdam. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Hotel With Some Quiks”
Reviews.Author: StarVox
Reviews.Content: My girlfried and I stayed here in early January, 2010. It is not quite as it seems on the reviews but was decent enough. The lobby is very small and the building, like may in Amsetrdam, is oddly shaped. The elevator is pointless since our room, listed as being the on the second floor, was actually on the fourth floor but the elevator only goes to the second floor. Even the desk cleark told us we were on the second floor (the room number started with a "2") - so you get off the elvator and then have to drag your luggage up to flights of stairs. The hotel knows this and never offered any assistance. The room was supposedly one of their "better" room - it was cheaply furnished and sparse but generally clean. Overall, if you don't pay more than $125 (US) per night I'd recommend it - the location is convenient - but otherwise the indifferent staff and less than memorable atmosphere makes me give it a thumbs down. We did not use the restaurant or get breakfast so I can't rate that.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: owlers
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my partner in november, we found the room clean and spacious and in an excelent location. The staff were helpful and i would not hesitate staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant, wonderfully situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: bajesma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a few nights in early November. Had a very pleasant, large double room up in the eaves, overlooking the canal. Comfortable bed, good bathroom with plenty of hot water, shampoos, shower gel, etc. All very clean and tidy. Breakfast was ok but nothing special, staff were very polite and helpful. Very conveniently situated, the tram stop is only a few yards from the hotel so you can easily get to and from the station and see the many sights of the city. There are also lots of shops, restaurants, bars and clubs nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommended staying here”
Reviews.Author: GillianF4
Reviews.Content: We got a lovely room on the first floor, overlooking the canal which was beautiful. Very spacious room after reading lots of reviews saying that there was a lack of space in Amsterdam rooms in general. Friends of ours did get a small room at the back of the building though, with a view over other buildings. Paying extra for the canal view was definitely worth it. Very good location. Easy to get to all the main attractions. Eight of us stayed there, and we all said we'd definitely stay there again in the future if we return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, big room, helpful front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: RossOttawa
Reviews.Content: We had a very large room overlooking the canal, much less claustrophobic than most European rooms. The front desk staff were very helpful with restaurant and attraction information. Location was great - easy walk to museums, many restaurants. Very handy to have the main tram lines (1 and 2) a few steps from the door. Only downside was very skimpy, expensive breakfast, but there's a good bakery right across the street. Some late night noise from nearby bar but that goes with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location and rooms with wonderful European breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: patnmj
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at this quaint hotel along the canal we received the best of care and pleasant service. Our luggage was stored in a small holding room until our room was ready and we were invited to have coffee in the breakfast room. We got lucky and our room was ready much quicker than anticipated so we were able to settle in and freshen up before hitting the streets of Amsterdam. Very close to the American Hotel and Plaza, the canal stop and the Rijksmuseum. Along a bus route. Bank ATM and small shops for postcards and snacks nearby. Quiet room with large bath and small balcony overlooking the city. We will go back there the next time we visit Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean & tidy rooms, friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: CHMcK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated to be far enough from too much noise but is still within a 5 - 20 minute walk of most of the nightlife, attractions & parks, etc. The room was clean, the breakfast was adequate and the staff were helpful and accomodating assisting me with storing my bags after check out, arranging my airport transfers and advising me of the best routes to take to find my way around the City.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with a View of Canal”
Reviews.Author: NiagaraRiver
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were from America, visiting Amersterdam for three days. We picked Dikker & Thijs Hotel because of the canal view - and we weren't disappointed. We had a decent-sized room with big widows that opened up to a view of the canal. The room had lots of character and charm. (Note: Our room looked much different from the luxury rooms pictured on the website, but we were still very satisfied.) Step out the door and you're right next to a tram stop that can take you anywhere in the city. (Get off at the Prinsengracht stop and you're right in front of the hotel.) You're right by Leidesplein, so it's a bustling area with lots of restaurants, bars, shops, street performers, and fun attractions. The noise from the street does continue on into the wee hours of the morning, so if you're looking for a "quiet" retreat, this might not be it. But we didin't mind too much, since we felt like we were in the center of all the activity. Staff was very helpful. We arrived early, so they held our suitcases until our room was ready. They were able to help us find major attractions, and were very kind to us when we entered and left the building. Only two minor negatives - 1. Wireless internet access was a bit expensive and slow. They charged us hourly and it wasn't nearly as fast or reliable as we were used to in other hotels. (We travel with Magic Jack so we can call home for free, but the Internet wasn't fast enough to support it.) 2. We had a double room. Like many European Hotels, they put two beds together to make a double. Unfortuantely, the beds kept sliding around the floor a lot. However, overall we were very pleased. We would return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location”
Reviews.Author: JoBNorfolk_England
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a 3-night break. The location was fantastic - in a little side street overlooking one of the canals. Period conversion with some nice features. We were close to the action, walking distance of most attractions, shopping and night life, and with a tram stop very close by, but away from the seediness of the Red Light District and all the stag parties. We had an 'exclusif' room (we'd just asked for a canal view if possible) which was HUGE and very clean and comfortable. Reception staff were friendly, but to be honest we spent most of our time sightseeing so didn't have much to do with any of the other facilities. Perfect for a weekend sightseeing/eating out type break.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: more_gelato
Reviews.Content: Perfect location: an easy walk to all tourist attractions and if you are lazy or it's cold, the tram stops within 30ft of the door. Gorgeous view from the room right onto the canal. Lots of restaurants within less than 5 min walk. The room was gorgeous and very large (#3xx). We got a package deal which included breakfast. I wouldn't pay E12, (there's a good-looking bakery just across the street) but since it was included, we went every day and enjoyed a plentiful fresh delicious breakfast in their clean sunny dining room. The staff was uniformely pleasant and polite. Cons: the beds were really, really firm and we had to pay for internet. It wasn't a problem for us, but there were stairs on the way to the room (after you got off the elevator) and the hallways were quite narrow.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant small hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: BostonTraveler62
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel, the room was nice, staff pleasant, terrific location in the middle of everything. Negatives are some street noise (it is on a major intersection), no A/C, absolutely terrible breakfast for which you have to pay extra (but there are many cafes and restaurants nearby.) Be careful about the room rate, I have stayed at very similar quality hotels in Amsterdam for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, and price!”
Reviews.Author: nmvelos
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights as part of a bike tour trip from Amsterdam to Paris. We were shocked at how large our room was! The bathroom was spacious and very clean. The view of the canal in front of the hotel was wonderful! It was a little noisy outside in the evening but we closed the large windows and it was quiet. There was no safe bike parking at the hotel but we found a bike parking garage not far away. Great hotel for the money! The various people at the front desk were helpful, too.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy rooms, not that nice, good location”
Reviews.Author: CAHBoulderCO
Reviews.Content: We are a family of three, two adults and a 10-year-old. We booked a room based on a Fodor's review. What a disappointment! The only room they had for three was on the tram (elecdtric trolley) side and it was VERY noisy. The room did not have AC, but we had to close the windows at night due to the noise. The tram stops running around midnight and doesn't start up again until about 7:30 a.m. (I think), so it might be okay for someone who goes to bed later and gets up on the early side. Also, the carpet was icky. The rooms facing the canal might be nicer. Location is very good, but there are a lot of hotels with great locations because Amsterdam is a smallish city. We ended up moving to the Bilderberg Hotel -- a little more expensive -- and it was WONDERFUL!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: gonzokent
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in the door to the moment we walked out, this hotel catered to our every need. We rented the Penthouse for four days for a VERY reasonable price, which included breakfast the first morning (brought to our room, of course). It was a lavish spread! They also had a fresh bouquet of a dozen roses waiting for us when we got there the evening before. The view of the City of Amsterdam from the room was amazing, the space was very large and the king-sized bed was super comfy. We'd read other reviews about noise (it is right at the corner of a main stop for the trams) but we never heard a thing. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “no doubt that this is the place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: viajante2009
Reviews.Content: the best location i could ever get, huge rooms for Europe standards, very nice breakfast, huge windows with views towards the canals would go there for sure again, even with the expensive rate. It is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “a little noisy but enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: 2brighteyes
Reviews.Content: i stayed at Dikker & Thijs Fenice in mid-april... the room was a little warm and i opened the window, we were on the tram side... it was noisy till the wee hours of the morning but being from the village in nyc it wasn't unbearable. found the staff courteous and professional. the room was large, comfortable and clean. i would definitely stay again perhaps asking for a room on the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in good location but can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: HelmutSchnitzel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in May. It's right down the street from Liedsplatts (sp?) and on a peaceful canal. There were only two of us but they ran out of rooms and gave us a very spacious triple. Our room had a view of the canal and the large windows opened onto the street. I was there on a Saturday and Sunday night so their was actively outside both nights pretty much until 7am. I live in NYC and have no problem sleeping even when people are screeming right below my window. If you want to avoid the loud groups of people I would request a room not on the main street. The tram stops right outside, and also goes right under the window, which is very convienent. The trains that stop there go straight to central station too. There are numerous coffee shops right in the nieghborhood and plenty of places in eat in Leidsplatts. If you go to Amsterdam, rent a bike. It doesn't matter how long you are there for or what time of the year it is....rent a bike. You won't be sorry. Mac Bikes is a short walk from this hotel, just ask at the front desk. Also, don't spend the money on the breakfast, there is a little bakery directly outside, across the street. It's very good and about 10 euro cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: UKSanT
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night but it left a very favourable impression, so much so that I would stay here again on business or with the family if the price was right. Good points: excellent location, pleasant staff, room 504 was brilliant (huge, with balcony and floor to ceiling windows overlooking central Amsterdam's rooftops and facing the sunrise). Not so good points: Although the room was spotless, for some reason the bathroom had areas where dust had been allowed to accumulate, e.g. mirror frame, top of radiator and so on. The actual sanitaryware was clean, though. Also, I wasn't happy with the ridiculous two-tier breakfast. I think EUR12.50 for all you can eat is fine, but the second option of EUR6.50 for ONE glass of juice, ONE criossant and ONE cup of coffee was rather mean-spirited. Better just to have one all-you-can-eat option, because the second option just smacks of meanness. This is not a large, business-oriented corporate hotel so public areas are limited, reception is tiny and there's only one small lift. But that didn't affect my stay at all. It's a good, solid 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay.”
Reviews.Author: allesvoorjouw
Reviews.Content: Dikker & Thijs Fenice Hotel - Amsterdam: www.dtfh.nl After our 9+ hour flight we were surprised and happy that our room (203) was ready upon arrival at 10 AM. Staff very friendly and efficient at check in and throughout our stay. Small, typical european lift, that worked. Very nice,VERY CLEAN, largish room and bath with tub/shower combo. Comfortable bed and pillows. Seating area with round table and two chairs in front of 3 windows, side two of which opened up onto view of Leidsestraat and sideways to Prinsengracht canal. Plus a mini-bar for our beer, wine and snacks. Two door closet with plenty of space for hanging items. The only problem was, no in room safe, but safety box available at front desk- don't loose your key to the box, a 500(?) euro fine. Being so close to the "party area" of the Leidseplein we had to close the windows at night, being April this was not a problem. The trams stop running at 1 AM. A rare, hot summer it could be a problem. The hotel does have 2 A/C floors, but the smoking floor( 2nd floor) does not. Before checking out I investigated down the hallway and thought rooms # 207 (twin beds) or 206 (queen bed) would be a bit quieter, since they faced the Prinsengracht, away from the Leidseplein. We did not take the breakfast(12.50 euros), which was not included. There was a bakery on the opposite corner that had some very good chocolate croisants and the was free coffee service in the room. Overall a very pleasant stay, not sure however, I would rate this hotel as a 4 star, but a very strong 3 star hotel. I would however recommend this hotel to smokers (2nd floor) and anyone else looking for a good quality hotel, with a great location, clean room and bath, and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Acceptable to Good rooms”
Reviews.Author: moonman_9
Reviews.Content: When I stayed here previously , I had a room at the back with no view but it was clean and functional. I stayed again in Feb-09 and had a fantastic room at the front with a view of Prinzengracht Canal. I got it at a bargain price for 4 nights. It is in the busy and exciting area of Leidseplein which has great nightlife and is still bustling at 3am. If you only need a bed to crash out , you cannot do better than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: LNMP
Reviews.Content: Although I'm still not sure how to pronounce the name of this small hotel, we were very happy with our stay here! On 3 major tram lines and just around the corner from the Leidseplein, the location of the hotel was perfect. Wherever we went, it was always easy to walk or take the tram back. Staff were always professional and helpful. Our first room (#209) was tucked into a corner at the back of the building; there was no view, but it was quiet and cozy. After leaving Amsterdam for one night, we stayed in a much larger room (#102) that offered a view of the busy street below, but we never had any problems with noise. Both rooms had large, modern bathrooms with plenty of counter space and heated towel racks. I loved the comfy pillows and duvets on the beds. The only thing I didn't like was having to pay for WiFi service (through T-Mobile)... but that's a relatively minor complaint. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: capistrano99
Reviews.Content: Lovely place. Complaints on expedia mainly had to do with the lack of restaurant, the rude man at the front desk - honestly, I didn't have any problems. I was in a single room facing the street/canal - it was conveniently located across from a tram stop - down the street from the museums... and walking distance to a wonderful assortment of shops. I was visiting near xmas (21-24) so it was beautiful - weather was warm and no snow (compared to -where I had traveled from - Munich - there was snow all over the place). So I would definitely travel again to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: YouKnowItLeicester
Reviews.Content: Our group of 4 stayed here for a long weekend. Hotel is in a good location and of a nice standard. All the rooms were in good condition and very comfortable. The bathrooms were nice. Checkout is at midday which is very civilised! The only gripe is that breakfast is not included. Breakfast costs 12.50 euros. There are loads of places within walking distance that do breakfast, so this really isn't a major problem. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for room 504!”
Reviews.Author: stellaz74
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in August, in 2 different rooms. The first room itself was very nice but was at the back of the building (room 301), thus overlooking an internal service courtyard and facing an air conditioning unit. On asking for a room with a view (any view would be nice!) we were told there were none available and to ask again in the morning. We also discovered the bathroom had a leaky tap which dripped all night (ok, once the door was shut, but it was hot water so it steamed up the bathroom!) Because it was leaking from the wall, when using the shower there wasn't much more than a dribble of water coming out of it. We told reception about it the next morning when asking again for another room. I suspect we got a good room because the owner was hovering over the receptionist â€“ we were delighted with our new room, much bigger and with a balcony set into the roof overlooking the rooftops and canal. The bathroom had been refurbished, had a power shower and a large window. This was room 504, and judging by the fire escape floorplan on the door, one of the biggest rooms, apart from the penthouse. Would definitely stay here again if we had that room! Location was good near Leidesplein. We walked everywhere, but there is a tram stop right outside and lots of bars and restaurants within minutes of walking. The museums are about 15-20 mins walk, Red Light district approx 30mins, flower market on Singel 10-15 mins. Breakfast wasn't included, but was quite expensive at â‚¬12.50 each so we went to nearby cafes. There's a nice bar in the hotel but it was always empty so we never used it. Never even saw staff in there but the it appeared open, with music playing!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, comfort & service”
Reviews.Author: chatnoiruk
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Dikker & Thijs hotel and found it great this time and last. This time we were mid week in the height of summer, a very hot couple of days (29 C), and air conditioning worked well - we were very comfortable in our generous-sized room which was immaculate, with very comfy beds. If you want peace and quiet, it is quite difficult to find in the centre of Amsterdam (capital city, after all!) so maybe go for a hotel further out (or take earplugs - then you can sleep thru anything!) The manager (Peter) was extremely welcoming and helpful, as were all the staff we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gor57
Reviews.Content: This is by no means a four-star hotel. It is seedy, dirty and rundown. While they advertise air-conditioning, only a few rooms actually have it. Mine did not. It was hot and stuffy. If I opened my window, I let in an enormous amount of street noise that continued well after midnight. At one point, I found my phone unplugged and had to squeeze behind the desk to find the phone jack to reattach it. Other than a closet for hanging clothes, there was no space for unpacking clothes. Yet there was insufficient space to set up the suitcase to live out of it. One positive feature was an in-room coffee maker, but you need to clean it yourself â€“ even from the former guests. I noticed flying insects in the room â€“ probably from the need to open the windows (with no screens) to make it livable. My three-night stay in this hotel was a most depressing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very expesive 2 star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NandJWales
Reviews.Content: 3rd June, 2008. Reviewer : N+J, United Kingdom We stayed here for 4 nights in May 2008 19-23. We booked directly with the hotel and paid 676 euros for a standard double, (room 401).no breakfast included. This was our first trip to Amsterdam, we wanted to treat ourselves to what we believed would be a 4 star hotel. How wrong can you be? We have only 2 positive things to say about this hotel. Very good location, good maid service.The rest left a lot to be desired, overall we were very dissapointed. The reception staff were verging on being rude, they were totally unfriendly, and not at all welcoming. Reception area is very small. The room was drab, furnishings were shabby as was the bathroom, which also smelled badly. The hospitality tray was frugal to say the least. There was'nt enough drawer space. There was no view from the room. window latches were broken. We did not use the bar or dining room, they did however try to charge us for 2 breakfasts. We would not stay here again and will not be recommending it to any one we like !! TAKE OUR ADVICE TRAVELLERS SAVE YOUR MONEY AND STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!! Do Not Even Consider It!!!”
Reviews.Author: Transcontinent
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. It is supposed to be four star, and was our way of "spoiling ourselves" at the end of an eight week trip. Well, we definately felt like something was spoilt! This hotel doesn't even rate 2 stars, I have no idea how they got their four star rating. The foyer is barely big enough to put your bags down in, the lift didn't fit both of us with 2 bags in it, the lift doesn't have doors and stops about 20cm below the floor, the hallway doors look like something off of Degrassi Junior High, the bathroom was mouldy, the toilet had poo stains in it, the carpet was rotting, the room stank, the "restaurant" was no more than a couple of tables for stale bread breakfast, the cupboard (not wardrobe) didn't have a hanging rack, the beds were small, the chair was broken and there was only one chair, the tv didn't work, there was no minibar, there was no room service, and I don't think the room had seen a duster or vacuum cleaner since the end of the war. Oh yeah, and the "balcony with a view" was 30cm by 80cm - not even big enough to fit the broken chair on. The two nice factors were the view was pleasant (but you could get it anywhere else in amsterdam) and the staff were friendly, oh and it was only about 150m from Anne Franks House. Please Please Please do not waste your money staying at this hovel, there must be other places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Solid 3 Star....Great Location”
Reviews.Author: clarelw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights - Fri 21st March - Mon 24th March. We booked through hotelbook.com and paid â‚¬330 euros in total for a standard double room. We flew into Schipol airport and caught the train to Central Station â‚¬4.10 / person. On arrival we caught a tram (1, 2 or 5 â‚¬1.60 / person - pay the conductor at the back of the tram) to Prisengracht. the stop is very handy as it's right outside the hotel. The hotel from the outside looks lovely. We checked in no problems and our room was ready for us at 11:30am which was very handy. We had requested a canal view room which we got. The room we stayed in was 305. It was average in size and to be honest I felt a little disappointed when we entered. The room in general is OK but needs a bit of decorating. The layout was also unusual with the sink area being in the actual room. The room consisted of a double bed, which was very comfy with fab pillows the best I have ever had in a hotel, desk, table & chair, flat screen TV, phone, tea & coffee making facilities, minibar, wardrobe - not much drawer space. The bathroom was tiny with a loilet and shower (with curtain) although it was clean. The shower area could do with a reburbish. Breakfast was typically dutch, bread, cheese, meats, eggs, cakes, cereals, jams, yogurts etc. We only made breakfast once but found the variety very good. It is served 8:30am - 10:30am on weekends and 7:30am - 9:30am on weekdays. You could also have breakfast served in your room for an additional â‚¬5 / person. Although there was some noise from Trams etc. this never bothered us once and we had no problems sleeping. The location of this hotel is fantastic for the Leidsplein area (1 min walk). there are great bars and restaurants around here. The piano bar is a lot of fun although drinks are pricey. The walk to Dam sqaure is about 20 mins and 30mins to the red light district. The geneal area surrounding the hotel is very busy. There is a bar in the basement which again we only used once to meet some friends and we the only ones in there, but it is nice. there are also free coffee and teas in there for residents. Safety deposit boxes are available behind reception free of charge, just don't lose the key as they will charge you â‚¬500. There is also a luggage storage room. An Internet PC is available in reception at a charge. You are required to hand in your room key when you leave the hotel and collect it when you return. Just one thing to note: although it had no impact on us as we don't partake there is a no soft / hard drug policy in the hotel and fines in place if found in breach. Overall we enjoyed our stay and if you can get a good price then it's worth staying there. I wouldn't pay more than â‚¬110 / night for a standard room though. Clare P.S. The only trams we caught were to / from Central Station when transferring to / from the airport. We walked everywhere else and nothing ever took us longer than 30 mins to get to including Red Light District, Anne Franks House, Rijksmuseum Any questions feel fre to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “What a location!”
Reviews.Author: cckone
Reviews.Content: This traditional hotel has an excellent location as most sights in Amsterdam can be reached by foot or by tramway which stops in front of the hotel. Don't even think of having a car in Amsterdam! The hotel staff was efficient but not exactly warm and welcoming; the included comprehensive Dutch Breakfast with boiled eggs, yoghurt, fresh fruit, juices, various breads, cold cuts and cheeses was excellent. The Breakfast room is furnished comfortably and music plays in the background. Only Breakfast is served, no lunch nor dinner. Free WiFi in the building, including in rooms but if traveling without a laptop, you have to use a computer in the lobby and pay T-Mobile 5 Euro (approx $8) for a minimum of one hour use, what a disservice and how inconvenient for this expected amenity. Rooms facing the street have double pane windows blocking most of the street sounds and bathrooms have been remodeled; all spotless and well kept. One quirky thing is that the elevator doors have to be closed and opened manually so sometimes the elevator is stuck on a floor as the guest did not realize this requirement and the doors remain open preventing the elevator from moving.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CADreamin
Reviews.Content: We didn't have a problem with the majority of the staff; however, some of them definitely need help in the "multi-tasking" area. While our hotel room needed some updating (especially in the bathroom area), the bed was very comfortable and the room was clean and had everything we required. At first, I was a little miffed that our room location was in the back of the hotel and brought this up to the staff. I was told that our travel agent requested a "quiet" room and, since each night produced hundreds of revelers on the streets outside the hotel, we were given a quiet room in the back of the hotel. After talking with several guests who had rooms on the street (and were kept awake by all the noise), we didn't view our room with as much disdain as we did when we first arrived. Even so, this was probably the shabbiest room we had on our entire trip. A big plus was the hotel's location ... next to a tram stop, near a lot of shopping areas and many great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but not congenial”
Reviews.Author: DancerGuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for six days and enjoyed a comfortable, good-sized room. It was reasonably quiet and everything in the room was in good shape. We got the feeling, however, that the staff liked everything about their jobs except dealing with the customers. Several times we waited at the desk for two staffers to finish their chitchat before deigning to deal with us. More than several times, no one was at the front desk and we had to wait outside, the main hotel door locked, before the desk attendant came back and opened the door. This was not late at night, by the way, it was mid-day. The staff were all polite, but in a very correct and frosty way, and they seemed anxious that any discussions with guests should not extend one second longer than necessary. We took it in stride, as Holland is an easy place to get around in, and we didn't need their help so much anyway. Be aware that most of the restaurants in the nearby Leidesplein are over-priced tourist traps with mediocre food. Fortunately there is a great sandwich shop directly across the canal, and many other decent places a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: line67
Reviews.Content: Great stay at this hotel last November. Penthouse suite was excellent, stunning views to the city and the canal. Good breakfast including serials defferent kinds of breads and fresh fruites. The best about this hotel is the location. Close to Dam square and all the major attractions. Walking distances to everything. Use the tram line to see arround the most beautiful and romantic city in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay in this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Cosy-get-away
Reviews.Content: Hi There, We went to Amsterdam for a long weekend, returning on the 18th November 2007. For value for money this hotel was great: It's central, comfortable and friendly. The staff were very helpful and full of good advice. There is some noise from outside but surely staying in a town there's going to be? I enjoyed hearing the trams and bustle of the town, surely this is why you go on a city break to experience city life and all that goes with it! The room was a bit of a strange lay out, but it was all functional and served it's purpose. Beds were really comfortable and the rooms were warm and clean. The breakfast was varied, not Full English but filling non-the-less, with pastries, toast (fruit toast too) eggs, cereals, Tea, juice and cheese etc. If you want a quiet holiday dont go to Amsterdam, it's full of character and life, and I would recommend staying at this hotel as it is in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Had been expecting a Bit More, though good location”
Reviews.Author: NikJ
Reviews.Content: Located in good location next to canal and tram location on Leidesstraat. Good Amsterdam restaurants very closeby. Internal to the hotel, old building causes narrow passageways, Rooms are also small in comparison to modern hotels, and don't seem purpose built, with basin directly in front of door as you enter the room. Rooms also relatively small, though with a small flat screen tv on the wall, the room was dominated by the bed. Bed was comfortable, & lots of large pillows. Outside noise during the night was a bit of a concern, though there were blackout curtains which helped with the light. Hotel has a policy of ensuring keys are left with reception as you go out, and reception staff also observant and knowledgable of the residents. The hotel also has a small lift. Breakfast is served on a ground floor, with a more continental-style breakfast with a small selection of cereals, breads, pastries and fruit. There was also a bowl of "hot" water for the boiling of an egg, though for 12mins for hard-boiled, it must not have been that hot. Bar area in the evening was quiet (by the breakfast area)... indeed for 2 hours, we were the only 2 people in there. Overall, good, though I had been expecting better.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: hilly10
Reviews.Content: The Dikker & Thijis Fenice Hotel - is a beautiful hotel - the staff are very helpful - the breakfast is excellant (fresh fruit, cereals, hard boil eggs, coffee, teas, fruit juices, different types of bread). The bedrooms are soooooo comfortable and clean, big bed, large pillows, wanted to take the bed home with me!! The location for visiting the sights is perfect, one way is Ann Franks house and the other is Van Gogh museum. Everything is walkable from this hotel but you also have the option of a tram stop outside the hotel. Getting to the hotel is a tram stop (tram 5) is right outside the door of the hotel from central station. You also have beautiful view of the canal. I read some reviews of other hotels that their was alot of street noise, well with this hotel their was none what so ever. The location is perfect for shopping and eating as you are in the middle of a excellant area for shops and restaurants. After reading alot of reviews about hotels in amsterdam i was scared that the holiday was going to be a nightmare - now after visiting this hotel and amsterdam itself - its my no1 city!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pros & Cons”
Reviews.Author: surreytim
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 2 night stay at the Dikker. Booked it as T.A. reviews on the whole pretty good and also keen on its location. Cant fault the reception staff, the breakfast was fine (albeit mayhem on the Monday morning) but the rooms could have been better. We requested a room at the front overlooking the canal. We felt the 2nd floor room was in need of an imminent update. The bed is too small by modern hotel standards and the pillows for us brits are useless. One is not enough and two is too much. They are made from a slab of foam, so have little give. The shower room is tiny and a bit grubby. Clearly there was once a door on the shower (now has a curtain) which fell off. Sadly the frame from which it beame detatched remains in its damaged state and looks awful. On the whole a bit disappointed with our room for which we paid 175 euro per night inc breakfast. However a great location for museums etc and having the 'benefits' of Leidseplein on your doorstep. Incidentally, the smoking rooms are for smoking, but not for 'smoking'. The hotel has a policy of NO 'smoking' or big fines.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: iamsterdamed
Reviews.Content: If you are an American and planning your first trip to Amsterdam this hotel is the perfect place to stay! Went to their website and found a killer deal on the Penthouse suite, it was listed as a 2 night Honeymoon package and it was the best deal I found after spending days on-line searching and getting referrals from friends.
