The Penthouse is a 4.5 star experience on any US traveler's scale, jaw-dropping view, huge room, great king bed, an awesome view, cool AC, plasma TV, panoramic view of city, decent bathroom and â€¦ did I mention the view?!? The shower/tub combo was the only drawback to an otherwise excellent room. WARNING: the lift only goes up to floor 5, you have to climb some steep steps to get to the Penthouse on the 6th floor. Even with having to push, pull, throw our 5 bags up the steps the room was worth the effort!!! The staff had that aloof Euro attitude, but if you engaged them with a smile they were very helpful and went the extra mile to help recover lost luggage from KLM. The location is another big plus for this hotel! Located close to the Museum district and away from the crowded Dam square and packed Central station area, it is just steps away from the very cool and active Leidseplein area. A short walk and you are surrounded by restaurants, bars, coffee shops (I Highly recommend the Dolphins) and with a few more steps you can find less crowded local hangouts. Lots of shopping of all kinds and a few art galleries round out an excellent area from which to explore Amsterdam. Bonus: the hotel is next to the main Tram system for a quick, albeit crowded, ride to Central station and other Amsterdam destinations. The staff even cut us a deal on a 1 night return stay in the Penthouse at the regular room rate at the end of our vacation! $150 Euro for the Penthouse was our best bargain of the entire 3 week trip. The rest of the hotel amenities, bar, restaurant, internet, etc. were fine, but we didnâ€™t use them much since there are so many choices right out side the front door. We visited several of the other hotels we considered staying at and none of them came even close for location and price. If you are American and visiting Amsterdam for the first time you canâ€™t go wrong staying at Dikker Thijs Hotelâ€¦ ask for any deals on the Penthouse and enjoy the view!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money!”
Reviews.Author: jtriefen
Reviews.Content: For a quick weekend trip, we really enjoyed our stay. Clean, has charm, friendly staff, and big rooms. The furniture in the rooms are a little dated, but we loved it. Great location for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Stanny54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dikker and Thijs Hotel for 4 nights in July 2007, room no. 307. The hotel is clean, the staff are very helpful and the breakfast menu was very good. The hotel is situated on Prinsengracht and this is a good location to get to most attractions. We overlooked the canal and street below, it is a busy spot and the tram line is just outside. We found the first night rather noisy, however, having walked everwhere during the following days and sampling the local beers and wines we soon adapted! Would reccomend a visit to the Anne Frank House, 30 minute walk away, be prepared to queue for an hour or get there early. We also enjoyed visiting the Van Gogh museum and you have to go and visit the RLD! Cafe Het Molenpad serve great food, only 10 minutes walk from Hotel, do not be put off by its 'shabby' appearance, the staff are really nice and helpful too. The Pancake Bakery, 191 Prinsengracht, about a 45 minute walk away is wonderful, sweet and savoury varities. Haesje Claes Restaurant serve wonderful food, more expensive, worth trying their 3 course tourist menu for 20 euros, very good value. We enjoyed Amsterdam and will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Light Sleepers Beware!”
Reviews.Author: millerto
Reviews.Content: as others mention, the partygoers on Leidseplein can easily keep you awake until 6AM. Then the street sweepers and trams start up at 7AM. The hotel itself strikes a perfect balance between Old Amsterdam charm and modern efficiency. You may be able to get a room in back that's quieter, but that would eliminate the charm factor and for the rate they charge, that becomes a big issue. I'd imagine it's quieter on weeknights during the offseason, so if you want to stay for, say, Monday-Thursday in April you will probably be okay. The ideal clientele for DTFH are young people who don't have to penny-pinch and are in town to party. Stay out until dawn, then stagger back for a few hours' crashtime, then go out again for lunch, sightseeing, and another evening of bacchanalia. Repeat. But if you need a quiet place to sleep at night, you need to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “good...after a change of room!”
Reviews.Author: Henrythefish
Reviews.Content: We (middle aged couple) stayed 2 nights and our first room was at the front. At first we thought "how nice" given the view of the canal but we didn't think that at one in the morning we would be hearing the crowds on the street outside. Even at 6am I could here some awful Englishman singing God Save the Queen!! The trouble with the room is that there is no aircon and so we had to have the window open. The next morning we asked for a change of room so that we could get some sleep the next night. At first they said they were full. It took a lot of nagging on our part before they "discovered" that they did have have another room. This room was excellent. Ok, it was at the back and there was no view but it was considerably bigger than the first room and was quiet. Breakfast was good. Location is good, for walking into the centre and also out to the museums, although far from the station. In summary, the lack of aircon is a drawback, and makes the rooms at the front of the hotel unusable in warm weather. The room at the back however was excellent. But how does one get such a room? I had called the hotel before travelling and they told me my room was good and in any case`they refused to guarantee a particular room for anyone. So i would not use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Baldous
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend and can truly recommend a visit. Good value although not sure its 4 star. Def on the nicer side of town and right next to tram link to the station. Breakfast typical continental, rooms clean and staff (like most people in the city) were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Misticaber
Reviews.Content: I went with two other single women and shared a big comfortable bedroom. Everything was as described and the staff were very helpful and friendly.Breakfast was excellent and we were given a free welcome drink. The area is excellent too with a great selection of restaurants and bars but it felt comfortable to us away from the centre of the city. The trams stop right outside the hotel and are very frequent. A great stay, we will definitely stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: globalnomad59
Reviews.Content: My partner and I plus another couple were looking forward to staying at Dikker en Thijs for a long weekend in Amsterdam. I chose the hotel because I had lived in Amsterdam for ten years and had always wanted to stay there based on its reputation for being one of the best--NOT SO! I think it is time the hotel had its star status reviewed and at least one star revoked. From the moment we arrived at the hotel to check in we were treated coldly by reception. The rooms were by no means up to any four star standard I have ever experienced (our friends' bedding was stained). The rooms we were assigned were unappealingly decorated. All in all the staff was unhelpful and aloof. The only good thing about the hotel is its location and the breakfast was satisfactory. I would not recommend this hotel, especially as a four star category.

Reviews.Title: “Fall in love with Amsterdam and the hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: katerinaGR
Reviews.Content: We had our Honeymoon (7-12 May 2007) at Dikker & Thijs Fenice Hotel and it was the best that we could have done!!! We booked the Honeymoon package and stayed at the penthouse suite. It wa just great. The room was huge, consisting of a double sitting area (a sitting area with two armchairs and a table and one sitting area with a dining table and two dining chairs) , a seperate space with a working desk and the seperate area of bedroom. The bathroom had 3 different rooms: the bath, the wc and a place with a tiolet sink and place for your tioletries and other staff. Lots Lots of towels, super clean bed sheets, extremely clean carpet (the first time that we were wakling barefooted in a hotel room!!!). There's a kettle in the room, and complimentary coffee/tea. Also a fridge-minibar . The view? what can we say? just check the photos! The one side of the room was just windows, overlooking the whole city, the canal. So romantic, so nice. Breakfast is included, there's plenty to choose from: different kinds of bread, croissants, rolls and muffins. Marmelades, various types of cheeses , ham and other cuts, yoghurt, cereals, and fruit. Different juices, cocoa and of course coffee, hot milk, and teas. The staff very helpful and friendly, with top of the top the reservation mgr , Jolanda. The location of the room is very convivient. Just on the main shopping street Leidsestraat, 1 min wakling from the Leidseplein, walking distance - through shopping streets or canal , you choose!- to the very center of the town, to the museums, to red district, to the dam square. There's a tramstop for lines 1, 2 and 5 (from Centraal Station) right outside (stop called "Prinsengracht"). In total, our highly recommended choise for a marvelous stay in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Canal view? -well a couple of garbage cans!”
Reviews.Author: Hegemonia
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had great expectations about the hotel, mostly because of the great reviews it had had on this site. So, we decided to book it, because it was a reasonably priced for a 4(?) star hotel (there are no cheap hotels in Amsterdam(!)) in a great location. When we arrived, a very rude clerk gave us our room key, he didnÂ´t mention that our room wasnÂ´t non-smoking as we had requested. Actually our disappointment at smoking room was nothing compared to "the view" we got: A COUPLE OF GARBAGE CANS (check out the pictures!)! We complained about the room, but it didnÂ´t help and the clerk was, again, extremely rude (maybe he had a bad day?). At the end of our vacation I got sick and had a terrible fever.. The staff didn't let us stay in our room; we were forced to go out because they need to check every day that everything is ok in the room... As signing in they asked our occupation, we may have made a mistake by putting there "student", although my girlfriend is almost a doctor and iÂ´m a bachelor of philosophy. First of all, we think itÂ´s ABSOLUTELY rude to judge people based on their education and occupation...so if youÂ´re a worker, donÂ´t bother ;). Seriously, I guess that was the main thing why we got that terrible room. But the location was great and the staff except that one clerk was friendly. The breakfast was also good. Also the room was clean but a little bit noisy: neighboursÂ´ showers woke us up every morning and you could hear were they were from :). But after all, I guess there are great rooms at the hotel at the same price, cause we have seen beautiful pictures of the rooms in this site too. Maybe we were just unlucky, but thatÂ´s the risk you have to take?

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: CatsterLondon
Reviews.Content: We had one of the smaller rooms and although we didn't spent a lot of time in the hotel it was a nice stay. Good location. Clean rooms. Very helpful and friendly staff. The breakfast is good. I was very hungover the day we checked out and managed to leave some documents and my montly travel card behind in the room! When I got back to the UK I called the hotel and they said that they kept all of it and will post it to me the next day. I received it 2 days later. They were very helpful and it was nice of them to keep what seemed like other people's junk. I will recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: QuDee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent!! We were there from sunday to wednesday before easter - days I know to be quiet in Amsterdam, so we got a great room at a low price: just â‚¬134 for a huge double with a lounge-corner by the huge corner bay-window overlooking Prinsengracht and Leidsestraat. There's a tramstop for lines 1, 2 and 5 (from Centraal Station) right outside (stop called "Prinsengracht") The location very close by Leidseplein and walkingdistance (even for lazy me) to the the museums, is really fantastic! The room was clean and the decor tasteful - it's really spacious, which is unusual for old houses in Amsterdam!! It has an unbelievable view of the canal, and a really nice, and big bathroom (2 sinks and a tub). The room was located on the 3rd floor, so we were high enough up to also have a view over some of the roofs, (nice feeling of space and air), and to be able to have the window open, without being overwhelmed by the buzzing street below. There's a kettle in the room, and complimentary coffee/tea. Also a fridge-minibar (sodas, beer, alcohol), which we just took out, and used the fridge for our own drinks and food, bought at the local supermarket at a fraction of the price. Breakfast is included, and the buffet is continental - they don't say that anywhere, which unfortunately is probably on purpose. But even without bacon, beans and fried eggs, there's plenty to choose from: white and dark bread, croissants, rolls and muffins. Various jams/marmelades, cheese with and without cuminseeds, ham and other cuts, yoghurt, cereals, and fruit. Different types of juice, cocoa and of course coffee, (with hot milk - yummy!), and teas. And the funniest thing: a pot of almost boiling water on a hotplate, and some curious boil-your-own-egg-dipping-basket-things (-and that's my short description!). Never seen that before!! Security is good. I've been to Amsterdam before, and I've always stored my valuables in a safe, or held them close to my person where I went, and still felt a bit unsafe. At this place, I really felt I didn't have to watch my things all the time - which was really nice! Of course one should never be careless, but I certainly felt I didn't have to watch out all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: karussell
Reviews.Content: We loved the Dikker. The hotel was in a perfect location and we could walk to everything in Amsterdam from our doorstep. We had a superior room that was HUGE and overlooked the beautiful canal. The staff was helpful and very friendly. Breakfast was an extreemly nice selection of breads, meats, cheeses, jams, juice, fruit, boiled eggs, yogurt abd cereal. I highly reccomdend the Dikker to anyone visiting Amsterdam. In addition to the excellent services, the hotel was reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: boazrh
Reviews.Content: Good value. Would recommend

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Loch Lomond and The Trossachs National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: JaneF
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back after spending three nights at this hotel. We booked it through KLM and it was such a great deal, return flights from Glasgow and hotel all for Â£165!!! The hotel is extremely clean and although our room 205 had its faults (rock hard bed, sink from bathroom in room area, shower head not staying in place) overall the hotel was excellent. The breakfast provided is more than sufficient and there is a great choice of variety. The location of the hotel is perfect, Leidsplien area is certainly the best area to stay in and this hotel is right in the heart of it and is literally three steps away from the tram stop. Although the hotel is located in a busy area we were not bothered by the noise in our room. I would definately recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: slidhome
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel! First, the location is excellent! You are literally a stone's throw from the tram stop on Leidsplain. Also, the Leidsplain Street is awesome, with tons of stores, eateries, souvenir shops, and just about anything you could ask for. Lots of small bars, including sports bars, and nightlife that is within easy walking distance---literally 5 minutes! Now to the hotel---staff is very friendly and courteous. From the moment you walk in, you can tell it is an above-average hotel. My room was excellent---large, clean, big comfortable bed, separate shower and bathroom. After staying at a low-budget hotel in London for 4 nights, I had my best 2 nights of sleep at this hotel. If I return to Amsterdam, I will definitely stay at this hotel and I strongly recommend it to others! Also, the hotel booking was simple---I booked through the hotel's website...they used my credit card to simply hold the room, then I paid in full with the same card at check-out. They also accomodated me by storing my suitcase in a side room, since I arrived several hours earlier than check-in time. Strongly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Dikker & Thijs”
Reviews.Author: esstenn
Reviews.Content: Only just got around to writing this.... We have had two great stays in this hotel, one last year and one in 2005. The location is perfect! The staff are very efficient and our rooms were clean, comfortable and reasonably priced. I have stayed in many hotels in this part of Amsterdam and D&T is my favourite.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ricardfred
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at this hotel and had a lovely stay there. It's in a great location with trams 1, 2 , and 5 stopping just outside the door (Prinsengracht stop). The Dutch staff were all professional and very friendly. I booked a double room (103) which was bright, modern, very spacious and very clean and comfortable. It was totally soundproofed. Although it was on the first floor with trams passing by I never heard any noise. It was air conditioned so window could not be opened. The bathroom was also large with a bathtub and powerful shower. The bed was lovely and I slept very well. My friend booked a single room (205) and this was also spacious and comfortable, and had a great view over canal. We were both delighted and will definitely be staying here in the future. We never made it to breakfast due to late nights but the dining room looked lovely. The room had tea making facilities and there are lovely shops nearby where you can buy croissants etc. They have a secure room where you can leave your suitcase if you have a late flight home. The area is beautiful and safe with lovely shops, restaurants, museums, cinemas all within minutes walking. The trams 1, 2 ,5, to/from Central Station only take 10 minutes and cost â‚¬1.60.

Reviews.Title: “OK Amsterdam hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Voyager2005
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in Jan 2007 for business. This is a fairly basic hotel with some nice touches. I booked a superior double room which was very large. Nice big bathroom, with lovely shower. The room had 2 twin beds, desk, minibar, tea / coffee making facilities, satelitte TV and pay movies. I was impressed with the roomâ€¦.until I tried to sleep! The noise from the street comes mostly from the trams â€“ trams in both directions have to use 1 tram line for a 20m stretch and the way they indicate to eachother who is coming through is to ring the bell. Fine â€“ except when itâ€™s every 5 minutes at midnight. There is also a lot of noise from the party goers that wander past at 3am. The hotel doesnâ€™t seem to have done much to try and combat the noise â€“ no double glazing. The front desk girls are fine and very friendly â€“ but please try not to get the manager. Heâ€™s terribly patronising, and when I tried to book for a night the week after he told me the best rate was twice what it was on expedia. I explained thisâ€¦ but to no avail. He told me to book through Expedia, not directly with him! The wireless internet is 6 Euros per hour. Trams go right past â€“ a blessing and a curse. Youâ€™re right in the heart of lovely Amsterdam with Centraal Station only a 10 min tram ride away.

Reviews.Title: “high standard Dutch hotel but not a 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: chaoleonard
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right in the city center, few steps from leidsplein, in a historic building. Has beautiful canal view on Prinsengracht. Pretty and large single room with queensize bed. Normal size and little shabby Bathroom. The sfaff is unhelpful and not very kind. The Breakfast is in dutch style without hot milk. The noise from the street, force yourself to keep windows closed. The Dikker & Thijs Fenice Hotel is a high standard for A'dam hotels but finally is not 4 stars hotel. Each room has minibar and coffee and tea, but the kettle was very dirty . No airco, no security box. Customers: there are wireless internet connection very expensive by t-mobile!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: rosa63
Reviews.Content: We have just returned having spent five days at the Hotel Dikker & Thijs, however I didi feel a little let down, asI booked this hotel based on the reviews I read through trip advisor. The hotel is nice but definately NOT Four stars, I would rate it more three stars. It is stituated on a busy street overlooking the Prinsgracht Canal. Reception was very small the decor i found very tired and worn. Our room was on the second floor (208) has a canal veiw, and is in the older part of the building, which has a bit of a walk from the liftto the room, there were some steps that led down to the room as well. The room was large, spacious and comfortable, the room is cleaned every day with clean towels etc We requested a double bed on booking, however two single's put together sufficed. The bathroom was nice has a powerful shower, 'watch out for the hot water'. Being the hotel is on a busy street the noise level is miniumn. The staff were all freindly, polite and willing to assist you. Breakfast was standard, we ate breakfast out as there are so many places to eat close by. All the attractions are in walking distance, you can jump on trams 1,2,5 which takes into the old city. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Took a chance on the D&T, and it paid off”
Reviews.Author: Logan69
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ambassade on my last trip to A'dam and liked it fine, but was unwilling to pay the much higher rates there now. The location of the Dikker & Thijs just a block from the Leidesplein was a big plus, and their rates were much more favorable--AND included breakfast which the other hotel did not, AND included a free ticket to either the Van Gogh or the Rijksmuseum (my choice). Decided to try it. Glad I did. I requested a non-smoking room, preferably on a high floor overlooking the canal. As usual, they couldn't guarantee it but would try. I said the high floor over a canal was negotiable but the non-smoking room was not, that I would look elsewhere if they wouldn't guarantee it. After two e-mail exchanges, the nice reservations mgr promised to "block off" a non-smoking room for me. And she did. I also got a great room--504--on the top floor except for the penthouse. Very big. (I'd only asked for a single.) It had a balcony with a great view over the rooftops and canals. My one Dutch friend came over and checked it out and was impressed. What's the catch, you're wondering? There's only one. It wasn't air conditioned. I understand some of the rooms are; this one wasn't. It was unseasonably balmy in A'dam (global warming), but nights were breezy and cool, and I kept the door to the balcony open, so it was fine. And there was also a tall, rotating fan in the room which I turned on but pointed away from the bed, as I don't like wind blowing on me. Breakfast was plentiful and good. It didn't vary, but as I was there for only 3 nights, that didn't matter. The staff was courteous. It's an old fashioned hotel in that they want the key turned into them whenever you leave the hotel, but I had no problem with that. They were prompt with their wake-up call and in calling a taxi for me on my last morning. I have no complaints about this hotel. I would stay there again, although if it were in the dead of summer, I'd want an air conditioned room more than a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on June 16, for 3 nights. Location was great. It was very easy to find . Took the train from the airport and then onto the tram. It was right outside the hotel door. I found the Hotel to be very clean. The staff was very helpful as well. For the trams and entertainment being right outside your door. I heard no outside noise. Slept like a baby. Breakfast was very good. Plenty of food. Only some of the rooms have a/c . So it is worth the call or email before you arrive to try to request an a/c room. My husband and I loved Amsterdam and the hotel. I picked all of my hotels on my trip based on these reviews. And I was not dissapointed. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “some good points & some not so good points.”
Reviews.Author: deenix
Reviews.Content: Good points: *Great location (places to eat, drink, lots of shops, tram stops right outside hotel, beautiful canal side walks, brown cafes, coffee shops). *The surrounding area felt very safe & unthreatening at night. *If you get a room on the 4th or 5th floor, the view from the window is brilliant. *The windows in our room (on the 4th floor) were huge & one of them opened like a door so we could step out onto the small balcony (actually, it was more of a ledge than a balcony, nevertheless, it was lovely to be able to look out across Amsterdam in the mornings & evenings). *Plenty of hot water for showers. *The people in Amsterdam are really warm & friendly (a world apart from, say, Paris!!). Not so good points: *Our room was shabby & in need of modernisation. *The paintwork was grubby. *The shower hose leaked. *The hotel breakfast included green, furry, mouldy oranges, yumyum! *The room could've been cleaner. *There was quite alot of noise within the hotel at night (hotel guests). Hope this helps you to decide! Enjoy Amsterdam, it's a fantastic place.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Gwerinwr
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 gloriously hot days in the Dutch capital - hot weatherwise, that is (26C) - nothing to do with the Red Light District ;) Arrived at 11pm, after a stress-free journey from the airport to CENTRAAL STATION (train platform located right under Schipol - 1 way ticket to Amsterdam cost 7Euros/Â£5). THEN got conned by a Turkish taxi driver outside Centraal, who charged us more because of "ramps" en-route to the hotel. Charged us a staggering 25Euros for a 5 mins journey. Compare that to 12Euros for a hotel ride back to Centraal for our journey home (booked via hotel). You have been warned... Courteous English-speaking staff at reception. Tidy, spacious en-suite room, with TV and coffee making facilities (a rarity for Amsterdam hotels apparently). On my first morning, found out that the shower head was broken and leaking everywhere. "Uh, oh, here we go" I thought. After noting the problem to reception staff, it was fixed by the time I returned at midday. Breakfast was fine - the usual croissants, rolls, cheese, hams, boil-your-own-egg, toast-your-own-bread, juices, tea, coffee. Fantastic location for hopping on Tram no. 1, 2 or 5 (PRINSENGRACHT) to Dam Square - tram stops right opposite hotel. The only downside was tram noises from 6AM - 12AM daily. Fantastic location also for nightlife. The cafe bars and restaurants of LEIDSEPLEIN was 2 mins by foot from hotel. Spoilt for choice, with abudance of Italian / Chinese/ Indonesian/ Indian/ Greek / Mexican eateries. Macdonalds and Burger King also, if you must. Perfect spot to people-watch and chill out with local Amstel or Heineken beer. Again, the ONLY downside with this location was the street noise from partying passers-by heading home to bed at 4AM. Great location for the museum quarter, with RIJKSMUSEUM (handy for those of you who want to see Rembrandt in a hurry) and VAN GOGH MUSEUM 5 mins walking distance. Went for a stroll to litter-strewn VONDELPARK as well - which was dissappointing to say the least. Even the lakes was like a rubbish tip. Litter was a problem at DAM SQUARE as well - had the city's binmen gone on strike?? I'm surprised Queen Beatrix hadn't complained from her nearby PALEIS... All in all, a hot, hectic couple of days in a fun-filled city. Head off the beaten (cobbled) tracks, to the quieter canalside streets for an oasis of calm. One final tip? Pack a good pair of trainers/shoes, and BEWARE THE CYCLISTS! Their right of way rules!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back.....”
Reviews.Author: UMgirl
Reviews.Content: We will definitely be back. The location of this hotel was perfect for us(not in the center) but then again we are walkers. The room was very nice, double bed, chairs with table, desk ect.(as pictures on the website). The room had an entire wall of windows (don't worry there are blackout curtains) that overlooked the street/canal-just beautiful. The room had coffee/tea making facilities which was nice b/c I could have coffee whenever I wanted-and it was really good! The bathroom was a good size with a tub and good hot water and toiletries. The breakfast was more than standard which included coffee/tea/juices/granola and cereal/cold cheese and meats/breads with so many spreads to choose from/yogurt and fruit. It was more than enough to start the day and served in a very nice room. You had to leave your key when you came and went but it wasn't a problem at all, it's a small hotel and we never had to wait to do this-and the staff was very pleasant. The only negative I can say about this hotel is that the bed was very hard and uncomfortable but this is just preference (it didn't stop us from sleeping though). Also if you are a light sleeper you want to request a room in the back. The hotel is in a busy area and there is street noise until late-this didn't bother us though-again-just preference. All in all we will definitely be staying here next visit.

HotelInfo.Name: Dikker & Thijs Fenice Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Prinsengracht 444, Amsterdam 1017 KE, The Netherlands
